page.title: 05Filton Village History
page.content: Filton was probably a grassy place in ancient times.The name is probably derived from two Anglo Saxon words "filede"-hay,and "tun"-a village or farmstead.Little appeared to change over the centuries.In 1814 a rector of Filton wrote:-"Horfield is a most lawless place and Filton not much better---Horfield Wood was then on both sides of the road and it was not very safe to pass that way." Perhaps the most important date in Filton's history is 19.2.1910 when Sir George White founded Britain's first large scale aeroplane company.Filton's bus depot was turned into a factory ;a two acre meadow became an airfield. The works were a target for the Luftwaffe in September 1940.More than 70 enemy aircraft attacked,killing 72 outright and injuring 168 many of whom died later.
